de.dixti.jarscan
Class Options

java.lang.Object
  de.dixti.jarscan.Options

public class Options
extends java.lang.Object

Options contains all Options of JarScan.

getJarSuffixList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getJarSuffixList()
Returns the List of suffixes that JarScan identifies as archives for damage checks. This suffixes are only relevant for damage checks. Regardless of their suffixes jarscan recognizes all archives. The returned list is not a copy. So you can add suffixes to it.

Returns:
the suffixList

setVerbose

public void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
Sets the verbose-Flag that indicates that every scanned archive will be printed.

Parameters:
verbose - the verbose-Flag

isManifestScan

public boolean isManifestScan()
Returns true if manifest files are scanned for an entry. Keys and values of every entry are scanned.

Returns:
true if manifest files are scanned

setManifestScan

public void setManifestScan(boolean manifestScan)
Sets the flag that indicates if manifest files are scanned.

Parameters:
manifestScan - true if manifest files shall be scanned

getExcludeSuffixList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getExcludeSuffixList()
Returns the List of suffixes that are excluded from scanning. If you do not want archives with the suffix ".zip" to be scanned, you can add it to the returned list. The returned list is no copy. By default the list has size 0.

Returns:
the list of archive suffixes that are ignored

isVerbose

public boolean isVerbose()
Returns the verbose flag that indicates that every scanned archive will be printed.

Returns:
the verbose flag

getSearchString

public java.lang.String getSearchString()
Returns the String jarscan should search for

Returns:
the searchString

setSearchString

public void setSearchString(java.lang.String searchString)
Sets the SearchString.

Parameters:
searchString - the searchString

getFileExcludeSuffixList

public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFileExcludeSuffixList()
Returns the List of suffixes that are excluded from scanning by default if the -f option is set. E.g. if you do not want files with the suffix ".class" to be scanned, you can add it to the returned list. The returned list is no copy. By default the files that are not scanned are ".exe", ".gif", ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".bmp", ".png"

Returns:
the list of file suffixes that are ignored

getClassVersionString

public java.lang.String getClassVersionString()
Returns the class version String that is used to determine the compiler version of .class files. It must be something like: <1.5 or >1.5 or 1.5

Returns:
the classVersionString

setClassVersionString

public void setClassVersionString(java.lang.String classVersionString)
Sets the class version string.

Parameters:
classVersionString - the classVersionString to set

isClassVersionScan

public boolean isClassVersionScan()
Returns true if the -c option is set.

Returns:
true if the -c option is set
